meanings.sent1: The ponging garbage made everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with a ponging odor that made me feel sick.
meanings.sent3: The ponging socks in the laundry basket were like a stinky cloud.
meanings.sent4: The ponging smell from the dumpster was a foul reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The ponging stench was so overpowering, it lingered for hours.

meanings.definition: To have a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: After a few days, the trash started ponging in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The flowers ponging in the vase needed to be thrown out.
meanings.sent3: The cheese left out too long began ponging like old gym socks.
meanings.sent4: The alley behind the restaurant was ponging with rotting food.
meanings.sent5: The dirty laundry was ponging up the whole room with its musty scent.

meanings.sent1: The ponging from the sewer was unbearable on hot days.
meanings.sent2: The ponging of rotten eggs filled the kitchen after the power outage.
meanings.sent3: The ponging of the skunk spray made the dog regret chasing it.
meanings.sent4: The ponging of burnt popcorn wafted through the office building.
meanings.sent5: The ponging of the fish market hit us as soon as we turned the corner.
